summary:
As a process engineer at AstraZeneca, I work in the BioPharmaceutical Development (BPD) department, where I develop and improve fill/finish processes and transfer the processing technology for biological drug products such as mAbs, bispecifics, ADCs, and other CVRM therapeutic products. I liaise with formulation and engineering teams in R&D and manufacturing sites across the globe, as well as author regulatory filings such as IND, BLA, etc. I am responsible for project timeline and budget management on various CMC committees. I am also the Microsoft HoloLens II SME, BPD social committee member, as well as ThisismeBPD I&D team member contributing to building an inclusive, kind, and collaborative workplace at AstraZeneca. 

I have a master's degree in biochemical engineering from UCL, and a bachelor's degree in biotechnology from the University of Edinburgh. I have also gained consulting experience from internships at De Kleine Consultant and London Strategic Consulting, where I performed primary and secondary research in customer segments and market landscaping, as well as  conducted data analysis on biomedical devices and consumer e-commerce markets. Furthermore, I presented market entrance strategies and litigation advices to clients. I have multiple awards and certifications, including AstraZeneca Science Catalyst award - Growth Award of the year 2022, “exceptional contributor” for my performance in 2023, a gold medal from the iGEM competition, a rural electrification project engineer certificate from WindAid Institute, and an international baccalaureate with a bilingual diploma. I am proficient in user research, presentations, and data analysis (via Excel, powerBI, and Tableau dashboards, PowerQuery, and python for data analysis), and fluent in English and Chinese. I am a passionate learner, a meticulous scientist, and a sustainability enthusiast, guided and inspired by the UN SDGs and the IB principle “we are all internationally-minded people, guided by our common humanity and shared guardianship of the planet, help to create a better and more peaceful world”.

currentPositions.description:
Working in Biopharmaceutical Development (BPD) within AstraZeneca; 
My area of expertise lies in (aseptic) fill/finish process development (ICH Q8, Q9, Q10; ISPE, PDA, BPOG compliant) and technology transfer for biological drug products such as mAbs, bispecifics, ADCs, and other CVRM therapeutic products. 
On the technical aspect, I'm responsible for process development and technology transfer, liaising formulation and engineering teams with manufacturing sites across the globe (main points of contact in the Netherlands, Germany, Italy, and the USA), as well as authoring regulatory filings such as IND, BLA, etc.. On the business function aspect, I am responsible for project delegation and management on various CMC committees, as well as being the subject matter expert(SME) in deploying the Microsoft HoloLens2 for business development activities. I have also been working on the Holo4Labs project developing a bespoke virtual experiment-assistance tool with a Microsoft partner company, winning $100K in development funding from AZ Science Catalyst Award competition (Growth Award winner of 2021) and IT infrastructure support in implementing the solution on a larger scale.
Member of BPD Cambridge Social Committee dedicated to bringing people across AZ together and helping to build a collaborative and supportive work environment.

Nominated for and awarded "Excellent Contributor" award by the Process Engineering department in 2023.
currentPositions.title: Process Engineer

projects.description: Mariah and I established the high school charter of UNICEF club as our IB CAS project. We registered for the official account online and conducted several fundraising activities in support of UNICEF. As UNICEF's principle states, "we aim to educate, advocate and fundraise on behalf of the world's children".
projects.title: CAS project UNICEF High School Charter

projects.description:
The University of Edinburgh’s team is developing SMORE standing for Site-specific MOlecular REcombination, a project focused on developing a fundamental tool for synthetic biologists based on expanding the toolbox of enzymes available for genetic engineering.

Genetic recombination is a natural process undertaken by all kingdoms of life, in which existing genetic material can be rearranged and new genetic information can be gained. For example, some viruses use genetic recombination to insert their entire genetic code into a host organism’s cell, effectively hijacking it. The cell turns into a virus factory that makes thousands of new viruses from the new genetic material.
 
Genetic recombination has also proven to be a powerful tool for genome editing and genetic engineering practices by taking advantage of site-specific recombinases – enzymes that facilitate recombination, but only at very specific places in the genome.
 
There are only a sparse number of site-specific recombinases that have been well characterised. To remedy this, SMORE is being developed as a complete toolkit of recombinases that have been thoroughly characterised. The team hopes that these parts will contribute to ongoing projects like Brainbow, a method that uses recombinases to make neurons express distinct colors of fluorescent protein, allowing individual neurons to be distinguished from one another when studying the brain.
projects.title: iGEM 2017

message.text: Great work by the leadership team. Glad to see the team stronger than ever and is continuing to grow. Exciting days ahead for Adipo Therapeutics !!

ingestedContentSummary.description: Adipo Therapeutics is a biotech company advancing the treatment of obesity by increasing energy expenditure through increasing metabolically beneficial brown fat using a 1st in class and novel MOA of Notch-inhibiting nanoparticles.
ingestedContentSummary.title: Adipo Therapeutics | Innovative Biotechnology | West Lafayette, IN

message.text:
Adipo Therapeutics is excited to announce the launch of our new website that  describes our mission, provides a scientific overview of our technology platform, highlights our management and advisory team members, and includes data and publications on brown adipose tissue and our lead candidate, ADPO-002NP.  To learn more about the novel 1st in class science of Adipo Therapeutics, please visit us at Adipotherapeutics.com

Where bold science meets an obesity epidemic.   Advancing the treatment of obesity by increasing energy expenditure through the unique benefits of brown fat.
